meanings.definition: To express (a quantity) in terms of a parameter.
meanings.sent1: I will parametrize the equation to make it easier to solve.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often parametrize complex data to analyze it effectively.
meanings.sent3: Why did the math book break up with the calculator? It wanted to parametrize its own problems!
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were parametrized by the colors of the sunset, each hue representing a different feeling.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful blocks to parametrize the concept of addition for the students.

meanings.definition: To represent (a set of data) in terms of a parameter.
meanings.sent1: We need to parametrize the results to show the relationship clearly.
meanings.sent2: The graph parametrizes the changes in temperature over time.
meanings.sent3: Why did the computer go to art class? To learn how to parametrize its data in a visually appealing way!
meanings.sent4: His words parametrize the essence of love, capturing its depth and beauty.
meanings.sent5: The map parametrizes the locations of all the important landmarks in the city.

meanings.definition: To describe (a mathematical function) in terms of a parameter.
meanings.sent1: Mathematicians often parametrize functions to study their behavior.
meanings.sent2: The professor asked the students to parametrize the equation for their assignment.
meanings.sent3: Why did the circle want to learn to parametrize? It wanted to be more than just a round shape!
meanings.sent4: Her voice parametrized the melody, each note representing a different emotion.
meanings.sent5: The artist parametrized the brush strokes to convey a sense of movement in the painting.
